content:
summerize these reviews: Linzi Schwartz
3.0 out of 5 stars Would not purchase again
Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 23, 2023
Size: 4 SliceVerified Purchase
I really wanted to love this toaster. I do like it’s sleek design. Unfortunately it doesn’t toast evenly. I get teased by my family for how much I enjoy a simple slice of toast, lol. I bought our last toasted all the way back in 2009, and it was just your simple 4 slice toaster. This time around I wanted to go a little fancier (for my love of toast). I must have read so many reviews that I got my toasters confused, because this one doesn’t even have a bagel feature and I wouldn’t have had it as a contender if I had noticed that. But that’s not even the issue after having and using it for awhile. I guess the bread I buy has larger slices than the average loaf. Not something I ever noticed before using this toaster. It cannot accommodate four slices. So if I’m making breakfast for the family, it’s two slices at a time. And some spots are nearly burnt, while others are barely toasted. When I do English muffins, setting 3 is to light and setting four is burnt. Since it’s digital, there is no in between. I have read the included book and put my slices in the center as it states to do when only doing two slices and still have bad results. I’m going to donate this toaster and purchase a different brand. Hopefully I’ll have better luck.

 Edward Farrey
3.0 out of 5 stars Another underachieving toaster
Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 21, 2023
Size: 4 SliceVerified Purchase
This toaster does not toast the bread near the top of the slice as much as the remainder of the slice. The digital deal seems neat, but you are left with toasting on 2 and then toasting a bit more.... a 3 setting is too much and the toast will be dark and dry.... the dial type controller on the old style toasters allows one to just dial in the right amount of time (time is actually all one adjusts in a toaster)..... the toaster looks nice
and is easy to operate but you have to baby sit your toast...... I can't believe various companies cannot make
a good taster ..... c'mon we have minds that can conquer this... it's just a toaster

Report abuse
 Kindle Customer
3.0 out of 5 stars Big and loud
Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 31, 2022
Size: 4 SliceVerified Purchase
Upon receiving the toaster, I was taken aback by how large, yet lightweight/flimsy it was. The dimensions are provided in product description so I shouldn’t been surprised. I’d recommend really measuring your space before buying. I have an angled roofline above where we use the toaster and it gets super hot at least 12” above the toaster. I need to pull it forward so the ceiling doesn’t get over hot. The sides of toaster also really get hot.

The cord isn’t super long so measure that too (27”, and comes out near-ish the plunger).

The big surprise is how jarring and loud the toaster eject is. The first time, my cat comically flew straight into air then ripped out of the room. Either I (and the cat) am getting used to it but over time it seems a bit less jarring (the 1st time was, as recommended, without bread to burn off the initial strong chemical smell — so perhaps weight of bread slows the eject down?).

I would not necessarily recommend the toaster but will keep it. My next toaster will probably be the America’s Test Kitchen highly-rated $100 Breville, this one was $35 ($40 minus $5 coupon). I do like the ability to toast 2 long slices (artisanal sourdough) or 4 English muffins at a time.

Report abuse
 Tim S.
3.0 out of 5 stars Top of bread doesn't get toasted!
Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 5, 2022
Size: 4 SliceVerified Purchase
Pros:
1.) I appreciate the wide slots for specialty bakery breads that wouldn't fit in a normal toaster and the ability to cook four slices of standard bread at once.
2.) The timing function is nice, especially when trying to get all the parts of the meal ready at the same time.
3.) It's fairly easy to use.

Cons:
1.) It doesn't seem to have a deep enough well for the bread, and/or the toaster elements don't come up high enough, so the top of the bread doesn't get toasted, and I have to turn it over and toast it a little longer on that side. Then the middle of the bread gets too well done. I like my toast fairly well done, but I hate hard toast, which is what often happens here unless you set it just right. I'd really like it to be a one-and-done situation.
2.) The clean-out tray at the bottom never seems to have much on it when I try to empty it, yet the toaster spews crumbs and seeds all over the counter all the time, even when the clean-up tray is inserted.

In conclusion, I'm glad I didn't pay much for this toaster because the cons outweigh the pros, in my opinion. I'm going to look for a new toaster and read the reviews carefully and thoroughly this time.

 Kindle Customer
3.0 out of 5 stars Leaves all toast partially untoasted
Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 20, 2022
Size: 2 SliceVerified Purchase
This toaster is just ok. It has a physical lever to push the toast down, but you can't push the lever up to end the toast cycle early, like most toasters. You have to push a touch button on the side to cancel, meaning this element is controlled by a computer chip along with the toast level and will probably fail years before the rest of the hardware. But the bigger problem is that the toasting rack doesn't descend fully into the toasting zone, meaning even a bagel doesn't toast all the way at the top, while the bottom gets overly brown. I usually stand by the toaster and rotate the pieces. Kinda defeats the purpose.
Customer image
